documents.document: "Kites rise highest against the wind - not with it." - Winston Churchill
"Talent develops in tranquillity, character in the full current of human life." - Johann Wolfgang von Goethe
"Let freedom reign. The sun never set on so glorious a human achievement." - Nelson Mandela
"One of the greatest diseases is to be nobody to anybody." - Mother Teresa
"What is not started today is never finished tomorrow." - Johann Wolfgang von Goethe
"Every adversity, every failure, every heartache carries with it the seed on an equal or greater benefit." - Napoleon Hill
"Do what you can, with what you have, where you are." - Theodore Roosevelt
"A great man shows his greatness by the way he treats little men." - Thomas Carlyle
"People are just about as happy as they make up their minds to be." - Abraham Lincoln
"If we are together nothing is impossible. If we are divided all will fail." - Winston Churchill
"Every man is guilty of all the good he didn't do." - Voltaire
"Start by doing what is necessary, then do what is possible, and suddenly you are doing the impossible." - St. Francis of Assisi
"Aerodynamically the bumblebee shouldn't be able to fly, but the bumblebee doesn't know that so it goes on flying anyway." - Mary Kay Ash
"All glory comes from daring to begin." - Eugene F. Ware
"If you think you can win, you can win. Faith is necessary to victory." - William Hazlitt
"Act the way you'd like to be and soon you'll be the way you act." - Leonard Cohen
"Where your talents and the needs of the world cross lies your calling." - Aristotle
"How far that little candle throws his beams. So shines a good deed in a weary world." - Shakespeare
"Knowledge is power." - Francis Bacon
"A man should make all he can, and give all he can." - Nelson Rockefeller
"Improve your spare moments and they will become the brightest gems in your life." - Ralph Waldo Emerson
"Give a man a fish and you feed him for a day. Teach him how to fish and you feed him for a lifetime." - Lao Tzu
"Life is not measured by the number of breaths we take, but by the moments that take our breath away." - Maya Angelou
"I can't believe that God put us on this earth to be ordinary." - Lou Holtz
"A good head and a good heart are always a formidable combination." - Nelson Mandela
"Time is more value than money. You can get more money, but you cannot get more time." - Jim Rohn
"Time sets the stage; fate writes the script; but only we may choose our character." - Liam Thomas Ryder
"You are the only person on earth who can use your ability." - Zig Ziglar
"You will find the key to success under the alarm clock." - Benjamin Franklin
"Failure is the condiment that gives success its flavour." - Truman Capote
"The greatest thing in the world is to know how to be one's own self." - Montaigne
"Confidence is a plant of slow growth in an aged bosom: youth is the season of credulity." - William Pitt
"Knowing is not enough; we must apply. Willing is not enough; we must do." - Johann Wolfgang von Goethe
"Nothing is predestined: The obstacles of your past can become the gateways that lead to new beginnings." - Ralph Blum
"It is not because things are difficult that we do not dare, it is because we do not dare that they are difficult." - Seneca
"Failures are finger posts on the road to achievement." - C. S. Lewis
"The quality, not the longevity, of one's life is what is important." - Martin Luther King
"Do not bring me your successes; they weaken me. Bring me your problems; they strengthen me." - Anonymous
"To avoid criticism, do nothing, say nothing, and be nothing." - Elbert Hubbard
"Do not look where you fell, but where you slipped." - African Proverb
"I've experienced many terrible things in my life, a few of which actually happened." - Mark Twain
"If everything seems under control, you're just not going fast enough." - Mario Andretti
"What keeps me going is goals." - Mahummaad Ali
"You have to have confidence in your ability, and then be tough enough to follow through." - Rosalynn Carter
"Fortune favours the brave." - Publius Terence
"If you want a quality, act as if you already had it." - William James
"If you are not willing to risk the unusual, you will have to settle for the ordinary." - Jim Rohn
"Only you can control your future." - Dr. Seuss
"In the hopes of reaching the moon men fail to see the flowers that blossom at their feet." - Albert Schweitzer
"Throw your heart over the fence and the rest will follow." - Norman Vincent Peale
"You only have to do a very few things right in your life so long as you don't do too many things wrong." - Warren Buffett
"Without a sense of urgency, desire loses its value." - Jim Rohn
"Ability can take you to the top, but it takes character to keep you there." - Zig Ziglar
"Life is really simple, but we insist on making it complicated." - Confucius
"Hard work without talent is a shame, but talent without hard work is a tragedy." - Robert Half
"A year from now you may wish you had started today." - Karen Lamb
"Education is what remains after one has forgotten what one has learned in school." - Albert Einstein.
"The full use of your powers along lines of excellence." - John F. Kennedy
"Motivation is what gets you started. Habit is what keeps you going." - Jim Rohn
"The greatest danger in times of turbulence is not the turbulence; it is to act with yesterday's logic." - Peter Drucker
"For success, attitude is equally as important as ability." - Harry F. Banks
"Respond intelligently even to unintelligent treatment." - Lao Tsu
"The real leader has no need to lead; he is content to point the way." - Henry Miller
"We know accurately only when we know little, with knowledge doubt increases." - Johann Wolfgang von Goethe
"There are two ways to live your life. One is as though nothing is a miracle. The other is as though everything is a miracle." - Einstein
"We are what we think. With our thoughts we make our world." - Buddha
"Delay always breeds danger." - Miguel de Cervantes
"To change one's life; Start immediately. Do it flamboyantly. No exceptions." - William James
"To create something you must be something." - Johann Wolfgang von Goethe
"The secret of success is to know something nobody else knows." - Aristotle Onassis
"You must not only aim right, but draw the bow with all your might." - Henry David Thoreau
"A man with no imaginations has no wings." - Muhammad Ali
"All children are artists. The problem is how to remain an artist once he grows up." - Pablo Picasso
"Pursue worthy aims." - Anna Cummins
"That some achieve great success, is proof to all that others can achieve it as well." - Abraham Lincoln
"The more elaborate our means of communication, the less we communicate." - Joseph Priestley.
"People don't resist change. They resist being changed!" - Peter Senge
"Nothing, not even sheer ability, can make up for the dedication required for a successful business career." - Ray Eppert
"Discovery consists of seeing what everybody has seen and thinking what nobody else has thought." - Jonathan Swift
"When we see men of a contrary character, we should turn inwards and examine ourselves." - Confucius
"A person can succeed at anything for which there is enthusiasm." - Charles M. Schwab
"For a man to achieve all that is demanded of him he must regard himself as greater than he is." - Johann Wolfgang von Goethe
"The best way to teach people is by telling a story." - Kenneth Blanchard
"If you're not sure where you are going, you're liable to end up someplace else." - Robert F. Mager
One important key to success is self-confidence. An important key to self-confidence is preparation. - Arthur Ashe
"To get the full value of joy you must have someone to divide it with." - Mark Twain
"If I look at the masses, I will never act. If I look at the one, I will." - Mother Theresa
"Persistence and determination alone are omnipotent." - Calvin Coolidge
"Champions aren't made in gyms. Champions are made from something they have deep inside them . A desire, a dream, a vision." - Muhammed Ali
"Great works are performed, not by strength, but by perseverance." - Samuel Johnson
"The secret of success is to be ready when your opportunity comes." - Benjamin Disraeli
"Nothing is particularly hard if you divide it into small jobs." - Henry Ford.
"Nothing is more damaging to you than to do something that you believe is wrong." - Abraham
"It's not what happens to you it's what you do about it that makes the difference." - Wilson Mitchell.
"If you want a place in the sun, you have to put up with a few blisters." - Abigail Van Buren
"Everything has changed, except our way of thinking." - Albert Einstein
"Whenever you see a successful business, someone once made a courageous decision." - Peter Drucker
"In the End, we will remember not the words of our enemies, but the silence of our friends." - Martin Luther King Jr.
"We can't solve problems by using the same kind of thinking we used when we created them." - Albert Einstein
"Aim for the moon. If you miss, you may hit a star." William Clement Stone
